io.spine.server.model

Interface HandlerMethod<T,M extends io.spine.type.MessageClass,C extends com.google.protobuf.Message,R extends MethodResult>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the target object
    M - the type of the incoming message class
    C - the type of the message context or Empty if a context parameter is never used
    R - the type of the method result object
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CommandingMethod<M,C,R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHandlerMethod, CommandAcceptingMethod, CommandHandlerMethod, CommandSubstituteMethod, EventApplier, EventReactorMethod, EventSubscriberMethod, RejectionReactorMethod, RejectionSubscriberMethod

    public interface HandlerMethod<T,M extends io.spine.type.MessageClass,C extends com.google.protobuf.Message,R extends MethodResult>
    Describes a method that accepts a message and optionally its context.

    • Method Summary

      Invokes the method to handle message with the context.
      default boolean isDomestic()
      Verifies if the passed method is domestic, that is not marked as external).

      Verifies if the passed method is external.

      • invoke

        R invoke(T target,
         com.google.protobuf.Message message,
         C context)
        Invokes the method to handle message with the context.
        Parameters:
        target - the target object on which call the method
        message - the message to handle
        context - the context of the message
        Returns:
        the result of message handling

      • isExternal

        default boolean isExternal()
        Verifies if the passed method is external.

      • isDomestic

        default boolean isDomestic()
        Verifies if the passed method is domestic, that is not marked as external).

      • ensureExternalMatch

        default void ensureExternalMatch(boolean expectedValue)
        Ensures that the external attribute of the method is the one expected.

        This method is for checking that an external attribute of a message context matches the one set for the handler method.

        Parameters:
        expectedValue - an expected value of the external attribute
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if the value does not meet the expectation.
        See Also:
        ExternalAttribute
